cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice another nonland permanent. If you do, you may cast a permanent spell with mana value equal to one plus the sacrificed permanent's mana value from your hand without paying its mana cost.

When The Arbiter's Watcher enters, create a function token with “You get {E} equal to this spell's mana value.” [i](It's an enchantment. As you cast an instant or sorcery spell, sacrifice any number of Functions to add their effects to that spell.)[/i]

Icedroid costs {1} less to cast for each card you've drawn this turn.
When Icedroid enters or you cast another spell with mana value 5 or greater, tap target nonland permanent and put a stun counter on it.
Whenever Lost Ghast enters or attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The fall left ghosts of the fallen wandering in its ruins. The Arbiter took control. Soon these ghost went from wandering to being puppets forced to do the bidding of Dazon's master.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever an Aura enters enchanting The Avatar's Warden, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
Whenever an Equipment becomes attached to The Avatar's Warden, exile the top card of your library. You may play it this turn.
Whenever Twisting Nebulas or another enchantment enters under your control, draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Hokori collapsed, leading the planes around it to twist and turn into one. Into an amalgam. Into a home. This is what The Arbiter knew.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an enchantment.
Return target enchantment with mana value less than or equal to the sacrificed enchantment's mana value from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you get {E}.
Whenever a noncreature spell is cast, you may pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}. When you do, counter it.

{T}: Mill a card.
Uncover {1}{B} [i]({1}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield, except it's an enchantment and loses all other card types. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield. Uncover only as a sorcery.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Even Baru had lost much from the fall.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Recursive Pyromage attacks, create a function token with “Sacrifice any number of tokens. When you do, discard your hand, then draw cards equal to the number of tokens sacrificed this way.” [i](It's an enchantment. As you cast an instant or sorcery spell, sacrifice any number of Functions to add their effects to that spell.)[/i]

Whenever you draw your second card each turn, you get {E}{E}. 
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}: Surveil 5. [i](Look at the top five cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Grand Oracles had chosen Drorix. It was time to choose again.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Often just a little pip will do.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Ikan seemed safe, but nothing can truly be safe while The Arbiter watches.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Gatu is full of emptiness, space that can only be traversed by those with specialized technology or those who don't need what humans do to begin with.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]In the depths, creatures that may seem abhorrent and disgusting lurk, waiting to take control of everything that crosses their path. Spores populate the air, and there's a distinct stench that always comes with the deepgrowth because of it.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]You might get whisked away or you may simply cease to be.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Draw a card. You get {E}{E}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]When the splinters of Hokori collide, inevitable disaster follows. Naroz and Ikan colliding was a death sentence to both splinters, so The Arbiter had to intervene to prevent chaos.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Arbiter gave its servants the same directive that it itself was given. To grow, to explore, and to expand. To grow meant to constantly keep changing and improving. cards.flavor_text: [i]Laba is by far the hardest of the splinters to get to, its gates located in the depths of oceans and forests. The Arbiter has its servants protect it by guarding both these entrances and Laba itself.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Sparks stolen from planeswalkers allowed for The Arbiter to control access to each of the Cosmic Splinters, including its home in Laba.[/i]
